title: Ricki Lake opens up about husband's suicide, witnessing 9/11 and burning her house down
text:

Former chat show host Ricki Lake has opened up about some of the horrifying tragedies she has endured, which inspired her to quit her job and leave her first husband.

The 51-year-old presented The Ricki Lake Show from 1993-2004, and starred as Tracey Turnblad in the original Hairspray film.

Now Ricki is preparing to appear on X Factor : Celebrity, Ricki has talked emotionally about the death of her ex husband, who took his own life after battling bipolar disorder.

(Image: ITV)

She married Christian Evans in 2012 and filed for divorce three years later, but they remained close until his death in 2017.

The tragedy had a profound effect on mum-of-two Ricki, who says she still feels him with her.

Speaking on the Dan Wotton Interview Podcast, Ricki teared up as she recalled finding out about his death.

"I don't know how I got home to LA", she said.

"You have to deal with the coroner and his family and his wishes and funeral arrangements. I don’t know how I did it all.

"He’s my favourite person. If I go there I could get really teary eyed — he’s literally the best thing that ever happened to me.

(Image: ITV)

"It’s nice to be back in London after having these traumatic experiences. I do feel that he’s with me.”

She now hopes that talking about bipolar disorder will help to demystify the "complicated, confusing illness".

She also wants to “get rid of the judgement and stigma” around suicide.

“It’s really out of their control, like cancer", she said.

"It’s not their fault."

She added: "I don’t want him to have died in vain. I would love to help others by being honest and transparent about what I’m going through.”

(Image: Rex Features)

(Image: PA)

Ricki also talked about the trauma of witnessing the second plane hit the World Trade Center in 2001 while she cradled her son Milo, then four.

It was a moment of clarity for her, and she thought to herself: "If I live through this day, I’m leaving New York and leaving my job and leaving my husband."

Then in 2010, she narrowly escaped a huge house fire started by a decorative indoor flame which caught her sofa on fire.

"The whole house was gone in 15 minutes", she said.

“We ran out of the house with my two children and my dog at seven in the morning, with the clothes on our back. I had no bra, I had no shoes on. It was incredibly traumatising.”

Ricki also talked about her belief that discussing traumatic events helps you to get over them, which is why she told the story of when she was sexually assaulted as a child by a worker in her parent's house.

“This was the late 1970s and it wasn’t talked about. You push everything under the rug", she explained.

(Image: Barry J. Holmes)

“It’s funny because that experience of being taken advantage of as a little girl is what caused me to turn to food, which is what caused me to be obese, which is what caused me to get the biggest break of my life in Hairspray.

"So again, trauma — I ended up turning it into a gift and a positive."

She added: “Obviously I wished that never happened to me. Once you unleash this secret it isn’t such a big deal, and that was pretty healing.”

Ricki has gone from eight stone to 14 stone over the years, and is now at a healthy weight.

She is now in a relationship with eco fashion designer Jeff Scult, who she met through a mutual friend.

(Image: Mike Marsland/WireImage)

"I’m in a beautiful relationship with this amazing man, I feel very in touch with my body", she said.

“He walked in and he reminded me of my husband. There’s an essence and a quality about him", she said.

"And it took him a little while to see me that way but I wore him down.”

In X Factor: Celebrity, Ricki will be singing Us by James Bay as a tribute to her late ex husband.

* The X Factor: Celebrity returns to ITV tomorrow night
description: The chat show host talked frankly about the horrifying trauma she has endured, and what it inspired her to do
